channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Photos: Deadly tornadoes hit Kentucky and Missouri
item.description: Over 20 people have died since severe storms and tornadoes hit Kentucky and Missouri overnight. Meteorologists are beginning to survey the damage.
item.content:encoded:
Over 20 people have died since severe storms and tornadoes hit Kentucky and Missouri overnight. Meteorologists are beginning to survey the damage.

(Image credit: Timothy D. Easley)
item.dc:creator: Emily Bogle

item.title: Paleontologists discover a 500-million-year-old, 3-eyed predator
item.description: Fossils of the underwater predator shed new light on biodiversity from the Cambrian period.
item.content:encoded:
Fossils of the underwater predator shed new light on biodiversity from the Cambrian period.

(Image credit: Danielle Dufault)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Fatal explosion outside fertility clinic was 'intentional,' police say
item.description: At least one person was killed in the explosion that damaged the fertility clinic, authorities said. The FBI said the explosion was "intentional act of terrorism."
item.content:encoded:
At least one person was killed in the explosion that damaged the fertility clinic, authorities said. The FBI said the explosion was "intentional act of terrorism."

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: At least 27 dead after tornadoes sweep through Kentucky and Missouri
item.description: Powerful storms and tornadoes tore through Midwestern and Southern states overnight Friday, leaving carnage and flattened buildings in their wake.
item.content:encoded:
Powerful storms and tornadoes tore through Midwestern and Southern states overnight Friday, leaving carnage and flattened buildings in their wake.

(Image credit: Timothy D. Easley)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Opinion: A wealth of wisdom for a bargain price
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon reflects on the discovery that what Harvard University thought was a copy of the Magna Carta is actually an original.
item.content:encoded:
NPR's Scott Simon reflects on the discovery that what Harvard University thought was a copy of the Magna Carta is actually an original.

(Image credit: Lorin Granger)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: Amid global competition for production business, Hollywood is hurting
item.description: Hollywood's plummeting film and TV production levels have studio executives and grassroots groups pushing for better incentives to keep business in California.
item.content:encoded:
Hollywood's plummeting film and TV production levels have studio executives and grassroots groups pushing for better incentives to keep business in California.

(Image credit: Eilish M. Nobes)
item.dc:creator: Mandalit del Barco

item.title: Trump plans to call Putin, then Zelenskyy, on Monday to push for Ukraine ceasefire
item.description: President Trump said he plans to speak by phone with Russian leader Vladimir Putin, followed by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and leaders of NATO countries, about ending the war in Ukraine.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump said he plans to speak by phone with Russian leader Vladimir Putin, followed by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and leaders of NATO countries, about ending the war in Ukraine.

(Image credit: Ukrainian Emergency Service)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The first time we had 'one big, beautiful bill' we called it Reaganomics
item.description: Budget reconciliation may not be catchy, but it's been a vital tool for many presidents, including Ronald Reagan, whose first federal budget was a watershed in the history of federal fiscal policy.
item.content:encoded:
Budget reconciliation may not be catchy, but it's been a vital tool for many presidents, including Ronald Reagan, whose first federal budget was a watershed in the history of federal fiscal policy.

(Image credit: Smith Collection/Gado/Sipa USA)
item.dc:creator: Ron Elving

item.title: Trump's DOJ focuses in on voter fraud, with a murky assist from DOGE
item.description: President Trump and his allies have long made false claims of widespread noncitizen voting. Now, as the GOP pursues new restrictions, experts worry isolated arrests will be used to push the new rules.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump and his allies have long made false claims of widespread noncitizen voting. Now, as the GOP pursues new restrictions, experts worry isolated arrests will be used to push the new rules.

(Image credit: Kayla Bartkowski)
item.dc:creator: Miles Parks

item.title: How DOGE has tried to embed beyond the executive branch
item.description: NPR has identified nearly 40 small, independent entities – both inside and outside the federal government's control – that a team of young DOGE staffers has tried to access in recent weeks.
item.content:encoded:
NPR has identified nearly 40 small, independent entities – both inside and outside the federal government's control – that a team of young DOGE staffers has tried to access in recent weeks.

(Image credit: Government Accountability Office)
item.dc:creator: Shannon Bond
